subject: Mental Health
title: 12-Step Programs
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: 12-Step Programs.

hook.text: Alcoholics Anonymous started in 1935 and remains the most widely used recovery program.

buildup.text: The 12 steps move from admitting powerlessness to making amends and helping others.

discovery.text: The social support and accountability in AA meetings drive much of its effectiveness.

twist.text: Critics argue the spiritual framework doesn't work for everyone and alternatives exist.

climax.text: Research shows AA is as effective as professional therapy for alcohol use disorder.

punchline.text: The oldest recovery program still works â€” community heals.
